content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 175.11 - Attendance in public school programs for certain pupils with disabilities

State Regulations
(a) For the purpose
of the apportionment of State aid to school districts pursuant to section 3602
and subdivision 3 of section
4405
of the

Education Law, the attendance of such pupils shall be calculated in the manner
set forth in section
175.6
of this Part. (b) For the purpose of determining weighted
pupils with disabilities pursuant to paragraph (i) of subdivision 1 of section
3602
of the

Education Law and notwithstanding any other provision of this Part, the
following definitions shall apply: (1)

Twenty
percent of the week means not less than five hours each week at the elementary
level and not less than 51/2 hours each week at the secondary level. (2)

Sixty percent of the school day means a
minimum of three hours each school day of each school week at the elementary
level, or a minimum of 31/2 hours each school day of each school week at the
secondary level. (3)

Multi-level
middle school program means a program provided in a public middle school that
consists of one or more grades below grade 7 and one or more of grades 7
through 9. Notes
